revised_title: Predator Inspection Behavior in Guppies: A Direct Fitness Benefit
tldr: The study found that guppies that inspect predators have a reduced risk of predation compared to non-inspectors. Using guppies and blue acara cichlid fish as a model prey-predator system, the researchers demonstrated that predators were less likely to attack and kill guppies that inspected them. This suggests that predator inspection behavior in guppies has a direct fitness benefit and can deter predator pursuit.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Animal Behavior
